description.narrative: Expected Output 2: Identify and elevate new solutions of which new sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDPs country programme and operations.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses.
2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies
3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative:
Output 1 1.1 - 2 new sources of data per year 1.2 - 3 different type of data sources per year 1.3 - 20 new potential solutions per lab per year 1.4 - 2 innovation methods per Action Plan
Output 2 2.1 - 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 - At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 - At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. 2.4 - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3 3.1 - The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network 48 interaction per year 3.2 - 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 - The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4 - Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

Accelerator Lab for the Samoa MCO began its recruitment process in the third quarter of 2020. All 3 new Heads were officially employed in October 2020 and have been immersed in learning through the bootcamps conducted by the Global office. It began its first learning cycle beginning of December 2020 with the expectation to close its learning cycle by the end of March 2021.
https://www.ws.undp.org/content/samoa/en/home/blog/2021/making-waves-in-the-pacific.html

Output 1 1.1 - 2 new sources of data per year 1.2 - 3 different type of data sources per year 1.3 - 20 new potential solutions per lab per year 1.4 - 2 innovation methods per Action Plan
Output 2 2.1 - 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 - At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 - At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. 2.4 - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3 3.1 - The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network 48 interaction per year 3.2 - 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 - The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4 - Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

Output 1 1.1 - (I) Primary & (II) Secondary data sources 1.2 - (I) Surveys, (II) Shadow Mapping - Participatory observation and User journey, (III) Open data - Household Census 1.3 - (I) Portfolio Sensemaking, (II) CERO Waste, (III) Moodle Platform, (IV) Limu Initiative, (V) Koko Initiative 1.4 - (1) Portfolio Sensemaking & Horizon Scanning
Output 2 2.1 - (I) Making Waves in the Pacific, (II) Hackathon, (III) Closing the Loop, (IV) Digital Inclusiveness, (V) Portfolio Sensemaking) & 2 posts published in Samoa Observer (Hackathon & AccLab Launch, and MOU signing with SBS) 2.2 - (I) Solutions Mapping with the Samoa Information Technology Association or SITA (Civil Society Organisation) - impact of the Moodle platform during measles, (II) MOU Partnership with the Samoa Bureau of Statistics to map solutions to enhance the birth registration system. 2.3 - (I) SITA, (II) SBS, (III) Pacific Climate Change Center hosted by SPREP Samoa 2.4 - Insights Report generated from the Savaii Mapping activity - recommendations provided by the AccLab were taken on board by both the Governance & Poverty Reduction Unit of the Samoa UNDP MCO but also SITA (https://sway.office.com/DXOQMOXNfbAs3NOP?ref=Link)
Output 3 3.1 - Samoa AccLab has interacted and engaged with its fellow AccLabs from Egypt and Mauritiania to share potential solutions and mapping activities on climate change and its impact one economic activities, connected with the Fiji AccLab to work on the MCPD Regional consultations, shared reflections and insights with the Trinidad and Tobago AccLab on navigating difficult conversations when hosting Portfolio sensemaking workshops. Samoa AccLab has also presented its Digital Transformation Big Bet with its SIDS Network of AccLabs. 3.2 - Unique approach by the Samoa AccLab on how it delivered its Portfolio Sensemaking was shared across to several AccLabs in particular our approach to team dynamics and navigating safe spaces. Head of Exploration also hosted an Explorers for both Cohort 2 and the recent labbers on procurement and programming UNDP systems. 3.3 - AccLab work has been featured on UNDP Facebook, Twitter, Samoa Observer, National Radio, & Television; as well as the AccLab Global networks. Samoa Acclab has also created a LinkedIn profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/samoa-accelerator-lab-undp/ - to date the analytics of having this specific page as seen 1 profile view, 20 post views and 3 search appearances. 3.4 - Twitter handles that the Samoa AccLab has scanned who to date have picked up weak signals and mobilised conversations and action includes but is not limited to @Lagipoiva Cherelle Jackson (verified journalist), @vaiala (verified journalist), @JoeMoeonoKolio (climate change activist), @jmauli (ACEO ICT for Samoa Water Authority), @upthenua (Pacific Health Advocator), @SitaLeota, @noelenen (DIVA Feminist), @ElizabethVKite (Tonga Youth Advocate), @BettyBharka
